Hi NEAT-ers, just wanted to remind you of the next CIG conference. (I
know =
several of you are already planning to submit and attend.)

Cheers,
Julian
=

IEEE Symposium on Computational Intelligence and Games (CIG-2009)
Milano, =
Italy - September 7-10, 2009
http://www.ieee-cig.org

The 2009 IEEE Symposi=
um on Computational Intelligence and Games brings
together leading research=
ers and practitioners from academia and
industry to discuss recent advances=
 and explore future directions in
this field.

KEYNOTE SPEAKERS
* Yngvi Bj=
=F6rnsson, Reykjavik University
* Stefano Lecchi, Milestone
* Michael Matea=
s, University of California Santa Cruz

TUTORIALS
* Playing Machines: Machi=
ne Learning Applications in Computer Games
Ralf Herbrich & Joaquin Qui=F1on=
ero Candela, Microsoft Research Cambridge
* Practical Issues in Evolving Ne=
ural Network Controllers for Video Game Agents
Kenneth O. Stanley, Universi=
ty of Central Florida

COMPETITIONS
* 2K BotPrize
* Defcon AI Competition
*=
 Ms Pac-Man Competition
* Simulated Car Racing Competition

More keynotes, =
tutorials, and competitions to be announced!

CALL FOR PAPERS
Prospective a=
uthors are invited to contribute high-quality papers
describing new work in=
 the field. Papers should be formatted according
the conference format avai=
lable at http://www.ieee-cig.org/

Topics of interest include, but are not =
limited to:

* Learning in games
* Coevolution in games
* Neural-based appr=
oaches for games
* Fuzzy-based approaches for games
* Console and video gam=
es
* Character Development and Narrative
* Player/Opponent modeling in game=
s
* CI/AI-based game design
* Multi-agent and multi-strategy learning
* Com=
parative studies
* Applications of game theory
* Board and card games
* Eco=
nomic or mathematical games
* Imperfect information games
* Non-determinist=
ic games
* Evasion (predator/prey) games
* Realistic games for simulation o=
r training
* Player satisfaction in games
* Games for mobile or digital pla=
tforms
* Games involving control of physical objects
* Games involving phys=
ical simulation

All papers are to be submitted electronically in PDF.

IMP=
ORTANT DATES
Paper submission: May 29, 2009
Decision Notification: July 3, =
2009
Camera-ready: July 24, 2009
Symposium: September 7-10, 2009

CONFERENC=
E FLYER
A conference brochure is available at:
http://www.ieee-cig.org/cig-=
2009/flyer.pdf

 Chair: Sung-Bae Cho

Pu=
blicity Chair: Julian Togelius

hair: Georgios N. Yannakakis

o

CONFERENCE VENUE
The symposium will be held at the Politecnico di Milano=
, the largest
technical university in Italy, ten minutes from downtown Mila=
n, the
shopping area, and its famous galleries and museums.

For more infor=
mation please visit:
